title.value: PHYLOGFN: PHYLOGENETIC INFERENCE WITH GENERATIVE FLOW NETWORKS
title.justification: The title is extracted from the paper.
title.quote: PHYLOGFN: PHYLOGENETIC INFERENCE WITH GENERATIVE FLOW NETWORKS

extractions.description: The paper presents PhyloGFN, a generative flow network (GFlowNets) model for phylogenetic inference. It tackles parsimony-based and Bayesian phylogenetic inference by exploring and sampling from the multimodal posterior distribution over tree topologies and evolutionary distances. PhyloGFN is shown to be competitive with prior works in marginal likelihood estimation and achieves a closer fit to the target distribution than state-of-the-art variational inference methods.

type.justification: The paper applies the proposed model on real benchmark datasets.
type.quote: We evaluate PhyloGFN on a suite of 8 real-world benchmark datasets (Table S1 in Appendix C) that is standard in the literature.

name.justification: The paper explicitly states the research field.
name.quote: Phylogenetics is a branch of computational biology that studies the evolutionary relationships among biological entities.

name.justification: The paper explicitly states the sub-research fields.
name.quote: In this paper, we adopt the framework of generative flow networks (GFlowNets) to tackle two core problems in phylogenetics: parsimony-based and Bayesian phylogenetic inference.

name.justification: The paper explicitly states the sub-research fields.
name.quote: In this paper, we adopt the framework of generative flow networks (GFlowNets) to tackle two core problems in phylogenetics: parsimony-based and Bayesian phylogenetic inference.

name.justification: The name of the model is explicitly mentioned in the paper.
name.quote: In this work, we propose PhyloGFN, the first adaptation of GFlowNets to the task of Bayesian and parsimony-based phylogenetic inference.

is_contributed.justification: The paper introduces PhyloGFN as a novel method for phylogenetic inference.
is_contributed.quote: In this work, we propose PhyloGFN, the first adaptation of GFlowNets to the task of Bayesian and parsimony-based phylogenetic inference.

is_executed.justification: The paper evaluates PhyloGFN on 8 real-world benchmark datasets.
is_executed.quote: We evaluate PhyloGFN on a suite of 8 real-world benchmark datasets (Table S1 in Appendix C) that is standard in the literature.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares PhyloGFN with several baseline methods including MrBayes, VBPI-GNN, ùúô-CSMC and GeoPhy.
is_compared.quote: PhyloGFN is competitive with prior works in marginal likelihood estimation and achieves a closer fit to the target distribution than state-of-the-art variational inference methods.
